arm_group.description: Administer vasopressin 0.05 or 0.07 IU/kg before sitting position during propofol anesthesia.
Administer saline 10 ml (placebo) 2 min before beach chair position during propofol anesthesia
Administer vasopressin 0.05 or 0.07 IU/kg 2 min before beach chair position during sevoflurane anesthesia
Placebo (saline 10 ml) for vasopressin is administered 2 min before beach chair position during sevoflurane anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients undergoing surgery in beach chair position (BCP) are at risk for cerebral
      ischaemia. The impacts of arginine vasopressin (AVP) on haemodynamics and cerebral
      oxygenation are evaluated during surgery in BCP.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vasopressin to Prevent Hypotension During Beach Chair Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing shoulder surgery in BCP under general anaesthesia are randomly allocated
      to receive i.v. normal saline (control group) or AVP 0.05 or 0.07 U kg-1 (AVP group, n = 15
      each) 2 min before moving into BCP. Mean arterial pressure (MAP), heart rate (HR), jugular
      venous bulb oxygen saturation (SjvO2) and regional cerebral tissue oxygen saturation (SctO2)
      are measured before (pre-sitting in supine position) and after patients assumed BCP.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: elective arthroscopic shoulder surgery under general anesthesia in
        beach chair position

        Exclusion Criteria: preexisting cerebrovascular diseases, history of orthostatic
        hypotension, age less than 18 yr, and the American Society of Anesthesiologists physical
        status IV or V

study_pop.textblock:
Patients undergoing shoulder surgery in the beach chair position under the general
        anesthesia
